Â Growing up Mormon, and then as a missionary, Sunday School and seminary teacher, I heard many, many accounts of the "magic" of garments.Â For instance, people being Burned on their arms and legs up to the hem of their garments, electric shocks stopping there.Â Surviving car crashes being attributed to their under wear, etc.
But mainly the "magic" was in the first principle of the Mormon faith - Obedience.Â They believe (and I used to teach) that if they obey all the rules the church sets forth for them - including wearing the garment - that then they qualify to be guided in their decisions by the Holy Ghost, which will keep them safe.Â So, it's more a roundabout magic.Â Â I will say this - it's a fairly good adultery preventative, as a reminder of ferocious oaths they took in the temple.Â Which may have been their original point.
Tarico is right - I was all on board with the Mormon project until I came across actual information.Â It all collapsed like Kleenex.Â Devastating.Â But I sure do have more time now, to get things done.Â And I don't live every minute in that constant "spiritual war between God and Satan" mindset that was so gratifying, yet so stressful.
